texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The  alacritty  terminal remains my favorite terminal because of its simple configuration, regular expression hints, and incredible performance. It's written in Rust and it uses OpenGL to accelerate the terminal output.

texts.text:
Xft.dpi: 96
Xft.autohint: 0
Xft.lcdfilter: lcddefault
Xft.hintstyle: hintmedium
Xft.hinting: 1
Xft.antialias: 1
Xft.rgba: rgb

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The first line sets the DPI to 96 (which is my preference). Increasing that number will take you closer to a HiDPI setting and potentially make text crisper, but larger. Lowering it will make text smaller and sometimes a bit ugly if you go below 85.

texts.orig: . On Fedora, install it, load your current configuration, and query it:
texts.text: . On Fedora, install it, load your current configuration, and query it:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
$ dnf install /usr/bin/xrdb
$ xrdb -merge ~/.Xresources
$ xrdb -query -all
Xft.antialias:	1
Xft.autohint:	0
Xft.dpi:	96
Xft.hinting:	1
Xft.hintstyle:	hintmedium
Xft.lcdfilter:	lcddefault
